title: [Large-Scale] Analysis of E-Learning Technology Adoption Factors: Application in Social Studies Education Context with FROG VLE Case Study

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills, understanding of educational technology, and foundational knowledge of core social studies concepts (citizenship, cultural diversity, etc.)
context.additional_context: Course analyzing e-learning technology acceptance factors optimized for mobile environments, targeting pre-service and in-service teachers. Based on smartphone-centered social studies learning activities (field investigations, community problem-solving projects) in PC-unavailable settings.

learning_goals: Applying mixed research methods (quantitative/qualitative), learners will analyze factors influencing e-learning technology adoption in social studies education (cultural context, civic engagement, etc.).

Learners will connect the seven core factors (usefulness, ease of use, self-efficacy, etc.) derived from the FROG VLE case to social studies education contexts (e.g., integrated history-geography lesson design).
Learners will derive adoption factors specialized for social studies education (e.g., local community problem-solving) when designing mobile microlearning in limited technological environments.

resources: Voice Recording App for Quick Interviews
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
